4891.title: First Floor
4891.description:
The floor has been remade, and is beautiful. A mosaic of color greets your
eyes as you look down at it. Bits of lapis, malachite, garnet, tiger's eye,
swirl and dance in a design of color. The surface of the floor is smooth,
each stone having been polished, but not so smooth as to induce slipping and
falling. The black-veined white marble walls are smooth and polished, gleam-
ing in the available light. Nothing adorns these walls, however.
A golden staircase leads upward. It is polished to a fine shine, and appears
to be in good condition.

4892.title: Second Floor
4892.description:
The floor is of obsidian and alabastar mosaic, held together with mortar and
polished to a shine. The circular walls are of smoothly polished obsidian,
the black and white dancing with each other in natural design. A huge former
fountain sits in the center of the floor. It is dry; no liquid flows within
it. A sign carved of light wood hangs on the new wall. Newly polished silver
sconces stand at either side of the sign and continue around the room in
regular intervals. These sconces hold glass containers which, in turn, hold
candles. There are thirteen in total around the perimeter of the room.
An obsidian staircase leads upward. It appears to be in good shape. You see
the glint of gold while looking downward, a golden stair, also in surpris-
ingly good shape.

extras.description:
+------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                  |
| "The Library of Thera was conceived and created by Xyza for Dark |
|  Mists. This area is not be reproduced or used in any other MUD  |
|  without the permission of its Author, reachable at this place   |
|  by sending a note to Xyza."                                     |
|                                                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------------+

4893.title: Third Floor
4893.description:
The granite floor is smooth and without flaw, polished to a shine. The feld-
spar and mica glint in the glow of your light. Polished golden sconces adorn
the walls. Engraved in the round walls are names, some familiar, some
obscure. There are several columns, also bearing names. The names are old
names, famous names in some cases, not famous in others. Leading upward, a
polished silver staircase shows signs that someone has been taking good care
of things here. A dark spot on the grey stone floor reveals itself to be an
obsidian stair leading downward. This downward leading stair is in excellent
repair. The southern wall bears an archway leading to another room. The
archway is lined with blocks of the same granite stone as is found on the
floor.

extras.description:
01. Telradion, human paladin, lawful good, inducted by Xyza
02. Cyro, ethereal channeler, true neutral, inducted by Xyza
03. Shylok, giant anti-paladin, chaotic evil, inducted by Xyza
04. Cirdan, elven paladin, lawful good, inducted by Xyza

08. Xurinos, drow channeler, neutral evil, inducted by Xyza
09. Tarot, human necromancer, neutral evil, inducted by Xyza
10. Llyfenerus, grey-elven channeler, true neutral, inducted by Xyza
11. Sinistrad, anti-paladin, chaotic evil, inducted by Rungekutta
12. Fevrea, grey-elven cleric, true neutral, inducted by Rungekutta
13. Lennart, human channeler, good, inducted by Rungekutta
14. Remus, channeler, lawful good, inducted by Riallus
15. Zarn, human anti-paladin, chaotic evil, inducted by Rungekutta
16. Valius, elven paladin, lawful good, inducted by Rungekutta

More names are farther to the right as you read.

Looking to the right, you see even more names.

85. Ghwyrgy, troll anti-paladin, chaotic neutral, inducted by Rupprecht

4894.title: Fourth Floor
4894.description:
The circular floor is a mosaic of polished stones held firmly in place. The
picture it forms is that of a lemniscate, or a figure 8 if you look at it
from the side view. Within one circular part of the 8 is a fiery phoenix
rising from dark ashes. Within the other circular part of the 8 is a swirly
darkness, as though the floor artist chose not to depict any specific holy
symbol, yet indicate that some darkness lay here. The walls have been
recently polished, its smooth stone surface very pretty. A stair of cast
iron leads upward, and near it, a polished silver stair leads downward.

4895.title: Fifth Floor
4895.description:
The floor is of polished zebrawood, its grain a pleasant natural design of
dark and light. A bin sits in the center of the room. Made of dark mahogany,
it contrasts with the polished zebrawood floor. All the walls have been
polished as well. Formed of panels of different woods, they contrast and
yet match one another. You recognize oak and maple, mahogany, zebrawood,
elm, pine, redwood, dogwood, and cherrywood. There are panels of woods you
have not seen before, or with whose origins you are not familiar. Hanging
on one of the darker panels of wood is a small sign. A polished wooden
stair leads upwards. Near the base of this stair, a hole in the floor
reveals a cast iron stair leading downward.

extras.description:
+---------------------------+
|                           |
| The bin is for collection |
|  of things to aid those   |
|   who would live here.    |
|          Please           |
|       do not take         |
|  of the contents unless   |
|  you are one who belongs  |
|      to this place.       |
|                           |
+---------------------------+

4896.title: Sixth Floor
4896.description:
This circular room has a spectacular polished floor of lapis lazuli, dark and
shiny, its golden veins contrasting merrily, running like simulated lightning
across the floor. The goldsmithery is still here as the great craftsman
continues his work on the altar. A newly constructed, highly polished, wooden
stair leads downward.

4897.title: Research Room
4897.description:
The floor is made of finely polished oak panels in a delicate parquet
design. The walls shine in the light of several candles in pretty cast
iron sconces. You count thirteen of them. This room half-circles around
the main section of this storey. The doorway remains open, leading to
the west.

4898.title: Dark Research Room
4898.description:
The floor is formed of dark mahogany panels, arranged in a pretty parquet
design. The dark walls, of the same wood, gleam in the light. Sconces of
polished brass are set in regular intervals along the walls, thirteen in
number. Each holds a black candle. The doorway remains open, leading to
the east. A shiny silver plaque framed in obsidian hangs on the western
wall.

extras.description:
+-----------------------------+
|                             |
|   This plaque is in honor   |
|    of Shylok the Lord of    |
| Fire and Ice, World Wrecker |
|   who was third ArchMage    |
|   and first ArchWizard of   |
|           Shadow            |
|    for all his service to   |
|     the House of Arcana     |
|                             |
+-----------------------------+

4899.title: Artifact Room
4899.description:
The walls here are finished, a bluish marble with dainty veins of dark and
light. The floor, completely restored, is of a similar marble, only a darker
shade of blue, or maybe the veins are more dark than light. In each corner
is a tall, golden floor sconce bearing a thick grey candle, a total of four.
An open archway, lined with grey stone, leads to the north. A small sign on
the eastern wall proclaims that Xyza, Goddess of Magic, once referred to
this room as the Artifact Room.

extras.description:
+---------------------+
|                     |
|    Xyza, Goddsss    |
|      of Magic,      |
|  Called this Room   |
|         the         |
|    Artifact Room    |
|                     |
+---------------------+
